item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, September 20, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:

2. Convenient code actions – Gleam v1.5 (28 points | 6 comments)

6. Gaining Access to Anyones Browser without Them Even Visiting a Website (7 points | no comments)
7. Why wordfreq will not be updated (138 points | 45 comments)
8. Accidental Spending: A Case For an Open Source Tax? (15 points | 8 comments)
9. “Gilded Rose” refactoring kata in Ruby — as if it is 2024 (16 points | 4 comments)
10. kl: An interactive Kubernetes log viewer for your terminal (10 points | 5 comments)
11. The Undeniable Utility Of CSS :has (13 points | 4 comments)
12. The unspoken rules of React hooks (4 points | 1 comment)
13. Visual guide to SSH tunneling and port forwarding (3 points | 1 comment)
14. Sans I/O when rubber meets the road (17 points | 1 comment)
15. Project ideas of pgwire (3 points | no comments)
16. Zine: A Static Site Generator Written in Zig (53 points | 29 comments)
17. Compile and run C in JavaScript (11 points | 1 comment)
18. A Signal run a day keeps the un-link away (32 points | 25 comments)
19. DirectX adopting SPIR-V as the interchange format of the future (4 points | 1 comment)
20. Unmasking vulnerabilities in cheap IoT cameras from one Chinese manufacturer (9 points | no comments)
21. Emacs bubble mode (3 points | no comments)
22. Where can a career in GPU coding take you? (5 points | no comments)
23. Why is it Okay to Average Embeddings? (1 points | no comments)
24. PC floppy copy protection: Electronic Arts Interlock (3 points | no comments)
25. That Time Berners-Lee Got Knocked Down to a Poster Session [2015] (27 points | 9 comments)
